author: Alex House
title: Scary weather changes Oklahoma football‚Äôs schedule vs. Maine
text: [Oklahoma football](/ncaa-football/oklahoma-football) (4-4) is not adjusting to life in the SEC as they had anticipated, losing their last three games in league play and getting dangerously close to failing to qualify for a bowl game. A meeting with FCS program Maine (4-4) is the perfect reprieve for the desperate and injury-plagued Sooners. Though, as has been the case this year for Brent Venables' team, [nothing comes easy](https://x.com/OU_Football/status/1852426926239166829) in Norman. ‚ÄúIn light of inclement weather slated for Saturday, and out of an abundance of caution and with student-athlete and fan safety as our top priority, our football game vs. Maine is being moved to 11 a.m. {local time},‚Äù the official Oklahoma football X account posted on Friday. ‚ÄúSome weather models show a higher risk of severe weather beginning earlier in the afternoon, which could complicate our ability to complete the game. The earlier start is also intended to allow everyone to enjoy the game and travel home safely before conditions worsen.‚Äù Oklahoma football must change their plans and intensity level Sooners fans will have to head over to Gaylord Family- Oklahoma Memorial Stadium a little earlier to start their tailgate and pregame festivities, leaving them with a rather short recovery time if they intend to party on Friday night (legally of course). Though, considering the home team is a massive favorite over the Black Bears, there might be plenty of students who simply decide to skip this non-conference matchup. The same cannot be said for the Sooners themselves. Despite being the vastly superior squad in terms of talent, Oklahoma needs to take Saturday's game seriously. It is a chance for it to gain some confidence and discover [its offensive identity](https://clutchpoints.com/oklahoma-football-brent-venables-gives-8-word-take-sooners-offensive-struggles). Quarterback Jackson Arnold showed clear growth in last weekend's loss to Ole Miss, completing 71 percent of his passes while throwing for 182 yards and two touchdowns. The downside is that the dilapidated offensive line surrendered a staggering nine sacks, one week after allowing eight. It is crucial that Oklahoma figures out how to protect its QB and give the wide receivers enough time to get down the field. Ideally, the trenches will hold up exceptionally well against Maine. It could be an ugly day in Norman as far as the weather is concerned, but the Sooners must make sure it is a highly productive experience all the same. Kickoff is now set for 12 p.m. ET.

author: MotleyFool
title: Why Lockheed Martin Stock Soared While the Market Sagged Today
text:
Kurse + Charts + Realtime | News + Analysen | Fundamental | Unternehmen | zugeh. Wertpapiere | Aktion | |
---|---|---|---|---|---|---|
16.04.2025 23:14:53
|
Why Lockheed Martin Stock Soared While the Market Sagged Today
Lockheed Martin(NYSE: LMT) and the wider U.S. defense sector provided lift to the company's stock on an otherwise bearish Wednesday trading session. Lockheed Martin's shares closed the day almost 2% higher in price, providing quite the contrast to the tumbling S&P 500's (SNPINDEX: ^GSPC) 2.2% decline.The analyst in question was Kristine Liwag of veteran white-shoe investment bank Morgan Stanley. Well before market open that day, Liwag changed her Lockheed Martin recommendation to overweight (i.e., buy) from equal weight (hold). In doing so, she added $50 per share to his price target on the storied defense stock, to $575 per share.The pundit's new take on the company was part of a broader Morgan Stanley update on defense industry stocks. According to reports, the investment bank rates the entire sector as "attractive," as opposed to its formerly cautious view that it'll be an in-line performer. The company sees the U.S. defense budget being set at $1 trillion this year, amid growing international exports of combat goods, as a positive for these stocks. Continue reading

author: Jason Cohen
title: Mother Of Hunter Biden‚Äôs Daughter Says President Still Has Never Met Or Contacted Granddaughter | The Daily Caller
text:
Lunden Roberts, the mother of Hunter Biden‚Äôs daughter Navy Joan Roberts, told British host Piers Morgan on Thursday that President Joe Biden has never contacted his granddaughter.
Roberts formerly worked as Hunter‚Äôs assistant and has spoken out about dealing with Hunter Biden following their child‚Äôs birth in 2018, noting both the president and his son‚Äôs efforts to distance themselves from Navy. Roberts on ‚ÄúPiers Morgan Uncensored‚Äù said neither the president nor his son has ever met Navy in person and that the elder Biden has never even reached out to his granddaughter. (RELATED: Hunter Biden‚Äôs Attorney Sends Letter Apparently Riddled With Falsehoods To Key Republicans)
WATCH:
‚ÄúHave you ever heard from either President Biden or the first lady directly?‚Äù Morgan asked.
‚ÄúNo. No, I have not,‚Äù Roberts answered.
Morgan followed up by asking if she thinks that‚Äôs ‚Äúsurprising,‚Äù with Roberts answering she does not.
Roberts also told Morgan that Hunter has never met his daughter ‚Äúin person.‚Äù
‚ÄúHunter‚Äôs relationship with his daughter has been built through Zoom,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúHe was required to call once a month or something like that. Navy gets to pick out one of his paintings, and that‚Äôs how they would start building a relationship. However, Hunter went above and beyond. He not only called her once a month, but once they started building a relationship, he wanted to call weekly or sometimes a couple of times a week just to talk to her. When she goes into surgery, he wants to Zoom and talk to her. He calls to check on her at different times and things like that. He has gone above what the time frame required and has done that for her, which I appreciate tremendously.‚Äù
Morgan asked if there are any plans in place for them to meet in person.
‚ÄúYeah, I‚Äôm sure,‚Äù Roberts answered.‚Äù Me and Hunter haven‚Äôt worked the details out with that. But, I mean like the world knows. Hunter has a lot on his plate right now. I think that that needs to be his main focus, and getting through this time and then the rest can come after. Navy is well aware. She knows that her father‚Äôs very busy right now, and he‚Äôs got a lot of things going on and she‚Äôs waited five years; she can wait a couple more months.‚Äù
Roberts and Hunter resolved their child support dispute in June 2023 and the Biden family finally acknowledged Navy in July 2023.
Roberts told Morgan that the ‚Äúdoor is always open‚Äù for the president to meet his granddaughter and it ‚Äúalways will be.‚Äù
Hunter gave his daughter some of his paintings and he paid Roberts‚Äô legal fees. She unsuccessfully attempted to grant her daughter the Biden last name as part of their child support dispute.
Hunter‚Äôs federal gun trial began Monday and he is facing three charges brought by special counsel David Weiss in September, which include providing false statements and knowingly possessing a gun while being addicted to drugs.
All content created by the Daily Caller News Foundation, an independent and nonpartisan newswire service, is available without charge to any legitimate news publisher that can provide a large audience. All republished articles must include our logo, our reporter‚Äôs byline and their DCNF affiliation. author: Charlotte Lesage
title: Eure: le collectif "Non √† l'A133-A134" d√©nonce le "deux poids, deux mesures" du "maintien de l'ordre"
text:
Dans un communiqu√©, le collectif regrette les diff√©rences de traitement entre leur mouvement, en mai 2023, et celui des agriculteurs. Dans l‚Äô Eure , le blocage de l‚Äô autoroute A13 par les agriculteurs ravive les tensions. Dans un communiqu√©, le collectif "Non √† l‚ÄôA133-A134" d√©nonce le "deux poids, deux mesures" du gouvernement et des pr√©fectures en mati√®re de "doctrine de maintien de l‚Äôordre".
"Aucune trace de condamnation" D‚Äôun c√¥t√©, la contestation agricole. Sur les blocages d‚Äôagriculteurs, autoris√©s par les pr√©fectures, en France, "aucune op√©ration de maintien de l‚Äôordre ou d‚Äô√©vacuation n‚Äôa eu lieu", constate le collectif.
"Le gouvernement allant jusqu‚Äô√† communiquer sur une ligne "laisser les blocages sur les autoroutes se faire", ajoute-t-il. Apr√®s recherches, le collectif affirme n‚Äôavoir "trouv√© aucune trace de condamnation de principe de blocages des autoroutes, aucune intervention des forces de l‚Äôordre, ni aucune menace de poursuite judiciaire".
Ce mercredi 24 janvier, par exemple, le collectif n‚Äôa constat√© "aucune intervention des forces de l‚Äôordre, ni saisi du parquet suite au blocage de l‚ÄôA13".
Une "r√©action raisonnable et juste de la pr√©fecture" qui tranche avec l'accueil qui √©tait r√©serv√© aux membres du collectif en mai 2023 sur ce m√™me tron√ßon de l'A13, selon la m√™me source.
Neuf √©cologistes interpell√©s en 2023 "Lors du festival des "B√¢tons dans les routes", "une action de d√©sob√©issance civile avait entra√Æn√© l‚Äôoccupation de l‚ÄôA13 pendant 25 minutes un dimanche apr√®s-midi", rappelle le collectif dans son communiqu√©. "Les forces de l‚Äôordre, d√©p√™ch√©es sur place tr√®s rapidement, avaient √©vacu√© l‚Äôautoroute sans encombre."
Dans la foul√©e, "la pr√©fecture de l‚ÄôEure communiquait tr√®s s√©v√®rement vis-√†-vis des concitoyens √©cologistes qui avaient particip√© au blocage, saisissant ensuite le parquet d‚ÄôEvreux" conduisant √† l‚Äôinterpellation de neuf personnes.
En mai 2023, "la pr√©fecture et les forces de l‚Äôordre avaient choisi de prioriser la r√©pression des manifestants, en se d√©sint√©ressant compl√®tement des mesures d‚Äôinformation du public et de d√©viation qui ont √©t√© imm√©diatement mises en place pour permettre aux personnes ayant besoin de se d√©placer de le faire". Le collectif "Non √† l‚ÄôA133-A134", qui rappelle d√©fendre des projets communs avec les agriculteurs mobilis√©s, attend ‚Äúun r√©tablissement d‚Äôune √©quit√© de traitement‚Äù ainsi que "l‚Äôabandon des poursuites contre celles et ceux qui ont √©t√© plac√©s en garde √† vue √† l‚Äôautomne 2023".
Charlotte Lesage Les plus lus

author: Rubicela Morelos Cruz, corresponsal
title: La Jornada - Detienen en Cuernavaca al presunto asesino de maestra Anayeli
text:
Cuernavaca, Mor. Un hombre identificado como Norberto ‚ÄúN‚Äù, fue detenido e imputado por la Fiscal√≠a de Feminicidios de la Fiscal√≠a General del Estado (FGE), por su presunta responsabilidad en el asesinato de la maestra Anayeli Soto Casillas, registrado el pasado 7 de diciembre afuera de la escuela primaria Aquiles Serd√°n.
Este hombre fue detenido, seg√∫n fuentes policiacas, el 22 de diciembre en las inmediaciones del puente 2000 de esta ciudad. Al momento de la detenci√≥n este hombre portaba unas 50 dosis de droga ‚Äúcristal‚Äù y una pistola.
Al realizar las pruebas bal√≠sticas al arma mencionada, estos determinaron que esta pudo haber sido utilizada en el asesinato de la docente de Educaci√≥n F√≠sica, adem√°s, seg√∫n estas fuentes policiacas, se encontraron en su tel√©fono fotos de la camioneta Nissan Kicks, que le habr√≠an robado a la docente, ofreci√©ndola en venta, seg√∫n informes.
El 26 de diciembre, un juez de control realiz√≥ la audiencia de imputaci√≥n en contra de este hombre y decret√≥ prisi√≥n preventiva.
Esta imputaci√≥n, a diferencia de otros casos que boletinan, no fue informada por parte de la FGE que encabeza el Fiscal General del estado de Morelos, Uriel Carmona G√°ndara.

author: David Rubio
title: Balonmano | ¬øPuede el Bar√ßa pasar a cuartos tras caer en Magdeburgo?
text: El Bar√ßa ha dado la cara hasta el final en la pista del vigente campe√≥n de la Champions, un SC Magdeburgo que demostr√≥ una vez m√°s tener m√°s vidas que un gato callejero para terminar imponi√©ndose por 29-28 con un gol en el √∫ltimo segundo de Gisli Kristjansson. El island√©s empieza a convertirse en un verdugo hist√≥rico de los azulgranas al estilo del 'Piojo' L√≥pez con el Valencia a finales de los 90 en el f√∫tbol o de toda la Jugoplastika en el baloncesto con el equipo que dirig√≠a A√≠to Garc√≠a Reneses como v√≠ctima. Lejos a√∫n de su mejor forma tras una nueva lesi√≥n, el central se lanza hasta contra una pared de hierro y consigui√≥ desestabilizar a la defensa barcelonista con cinco goles en la segunda parte y el de la victoria a un segundo del final. ¬øC√≥mo queda el Grupo B a una jornada del final? Pese a la derrota, el Bar√ßa tiene los deberes muy bien hechos en una excelente fase de grupos y se mantiene como l√≠der con 22 puntos, los mismos que el Magdeburgo y dos m√°s que el Telekom Veszpr√©m. De hecho, ya est√° en cuartos de final y veremos por qu√©. El equipo de Carlos Ortega recibe el jueves a las 20.45 horas al Montpellier en el Palau en un duelo determinante en el que los galos se juegan la cuarta plaza al tener a un punto al GOG dan√©s, que termina en la pista del Celje que a√∫n no ha sumado puntos. Sin olvidar que a la misma hora se disputar√° en tierras magiares un apasionante Veszpr√©m-Magdeburgo, el Bar√ßa se plantar√° en cuartos como primero de grupo si gana al exequipo de Richardson y su rival ser√≠a el ganador del duelo de octavos entre el quinto de su grupo (Montpellier o GOG) y el cuarto del A (PSG, Kielce, Zagreb o Pick Szeged). Caso de derrota, quedar√≠a con 22 puntos y una hipot√©tica victoria del Telekom Veszpr√©m ante el vigente campe√≥n provocar√≠a un triple empate que descabalgar√≠a a los alemanes de los cuartos y lo obligar√≠a a jugar octavos. El Bar√ßa est√° con +7 en esa miniliguilla de tres equipos, los magiares en +11 y los teutones en -16. Blanco y en botella. Es decir, que los cuartos son una realidad. Por tanto, pese a lo doloroso de perder de esta forma despu√©s de un gran partido colectivo con Nielsen, P√©rez de Vargas, Frade y Dika Mem como referentes, el Bar√ßa tiene medio pie en los cuartos de final y estar√≠a a solo dos partidos de la Final Four cuando todo parec√≠a ca√≥tico el pasado verano. ¬øLos culpables? El equipo y, con may√∫sculas, Carlos Ortega y su cuerpo t√©cnico.
